7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter."

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter."

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereon.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days of residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively, according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils referred to in the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, pasting it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading “Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter”.

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the “Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter” by the “Total number of days in quarter”.

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the “Average attendance of pupils during quarter” by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, any payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September, and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading “Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter”.

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the “Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter” by the “Total number of days in quarter”.

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the “Average attendance of pupils during quarter” by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

I HEREBY CERTIFY that the within Return is a true and faithful statement of the attendance and tuition at the School for the Quarter ended DECEMBER 31, 1951.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

**PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA**
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. PUBLIC ARCHIVES

ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES

CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES

CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading “Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter”.

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the “Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter” by the “Total number of days in quarter”.

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the “Average attendance of pupils during quarter” by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES CANADA
NOTES ON THE PREPARATION OF THIS RETURN

1. Fill in all the columns of this Return, giving full particulars in the case of each pupil, as called for under the various headings thereof.

2. The columns of the Return should be correctly added and the totals placed at the foot thereof.

3. When, owing to the number of pupils, all the names cannot be included on one sheet of the Return, use another sheet, paging it No. 2, and carry forward all totals, placing them in the proper columns.

4. The Returns must embrace only the quarterly periods ending 31st March, 30th June, 30th September and 31st December, respectively, and should be prepared and forwarded immediately thereafter.

5. No Quarterly Grant will be paid until Returns have been received by the Department.

6. The total number of days in quarter means every day in the quarter, including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

7. The aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter means the total number of days in residence of all pupils entered on the Return and is ascertained by adding the column under the heading "Total number of days pupils in residence during quarter".

8. The average attendance of pupils during quarter is ascertained by dividing the "Aggregate number of days pupils in residence during quarter" by the "Total number of days in quarter".

9. The amount per capita grant due for quarter is ascertained by multiplying the "Average attendance of pupils during quarter" by the amount of the quarterly per capita grant. In no case, however, will payment be made for any average attendance in excess of the number of pupils for which grant is allowed.

SPECIAL NOTE

A new number must be given to each pupil upon entrance to the school. On this Return the names of the boys and the girls must be arranged consecutively according to numbers.

ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES
CANADA
Ottawa, July 26th, 1929.

Sir,

The June quarter grant of the Lac La Ronge Indian Residential School is being paid on an average attendance of 100 pupils and the per capita earnings amount to $5,000. From this amount, the sum of $3,600., being an advance on the said quarter, is being deducted, leaving a balance due of $1,400., a cheque for which amount is being forwarded to your General Treasurer.

Your obedient servant,

[Signature]

Russell T. Ferrier,
Supt. of Indian Education.

R. A. Williams, Esq.,
Accountant, M.S.C.C.,
604 Jarvis St.,
Toronto 5, Ont.
Ottawa, August 19, 1929.

Rev. Sir:

I have been directed to acknowledge receipt of your letter of the 13th instant, furnishing the Department with information concerning Rev. G. W. Fisher, who has been nominated for the position as Principal of the Lac la Ronge Indian Residential School to succeed the Rev. C. F. Hives, who is being transferred as Principal of Shingwauk Home.

In this connection I have to inform you that the Department will approve of the appointment of Rev. G. W. Fisher as Principal of the Lac la Ronge School. It is hoped that he will meet with every success in his work at this school.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
Acting Asst. Deputy and Secretary.

Rev. T. B. R. Westgate, D.D.S.,
Field Secretary, M.S.C.C.,
41-43, The Bible House,
Alexander Ave., Winnipeg, Man.

Indian Affairs. (RG 10, Volume 6315, file 656-3, part 1)
Ottawa, March 2nd, 1932.

Sir,

With reference to your letter of the 27th ultimo, I beg to say that the December quarter grant of the Lac La Ronge Indian Residential School was paid on an average attendance of 100 and the earnings amounted to $5,000. The December quarter return of the Hay River Indian Residential School has not yet been received.

Your obedient servant,

Russell T. Ferrier,

Oct. 24, 1934.

Dept. of Indian Affairs,
Ottawa,
Ont.

Dear Sir:

I find on checking up the letters received re the June Quarter per capita grants for the Indian Schools under our jurisdiction, I did not receive a letter covering the Lac La Ronge School and the average attendance; I received a letter for the Moose Fort School which did not give the average attendance.

I shall be glad to receive this information and thus complete my records for the June quarter.

Thanking you in anticipation of your courtesy in this matter, believe me

EE.

Sincerely yours,

[Signature]

PUBLIC ARCHIVES
ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES
CANADA
The Secretary,
Indian Affairs Branch,
Department of Mines & Resources,
Ottawa, Ontario.

Dear Sir:

The Principal of our Lac la Ronge Indian Residential School has reported to me the likelihood of some delay in his December Quarterly Return of attendance of pupils reaching your office, the delay being due chiefly to the following causes:

(1) Some disorganization in the mail service between Prince Albert and northern points. The Principal states in a letter written to me on the 12th inst. that "two weeks mail for Lac la Ronge was lying somewhere between Prince Albert and that point". He adds that "a new contract has just been let for the mail, and we hope for better service from now on".

(2) A lack of the proper forms for the "Returns". He states that he applied to your Department for a supply of these on November 9th last, but up until January 12th none had reached him. There is, of course, the possibility that the forms may be in the mail which was left somewhere between Prince Albert and the School, and if so you may receive the "Returns" sooner than the Principal thought likely when he wrote.

Your obedient servant,

[Signature]

Secretary of the Commission.
Ottawa,
January 30, 1943.

Dear Doctor Westgate:

I have your letter of the 25th instant and on reviewing our file I find that quarterly return forms were forwarded from here to the Principal of the Lac la Ronge Indian Residential School on November 25 last. Under these circumstances I am inclined to feel that they must be with the mail which had not been delivered to the Lac la Ronge School at the time you heard from the Principal.

In order to assist your financing I am arranging to forward to your General Treasurer a cheque for $3500.00, being a part payment on the per capita allowance for the December quarter. The balance will be paid when the December quarter return is received.

Yours truly,

Philip Phelan,
Chief, Training Division.

Rev. T.B.R. Westgate, D.D.,
Secretary, Indian and Eskimo Residential School Commission,
M. S. C. C.,
38-43 The Bible House,
184 Alexander Ave. East,
Winnipeg, Man.
Province of SASKATCHEWAN.

Ottawa, March 18th, 1947.

Dear Doctor Alderwood:

We have not yet received the December quarter return of the Lac la Ronge Residential School.

Possibly the information required to prepare the report was lost in the fire. However, the December quarter return should have been prepared and forwarded to us before the fire occurred.

Anything you can do to obtain this return will be very much appreciated.

Yours sincerely,

Philip Phelan
Chief, Training Division.

Rev. Canon H.A. Alderwood, D.D.,
Supt. Indian School Administration,
M.S.C.C.,
102 Bank St., Ottawa.
March 28, 1947

The Director,
Training Division,
Indian Affairs Branch,
Dept. Mines & Resources,
Ottawa, Ont.

Dear Sir:

Re December Quarterly Return, I. R. School, Lac la Ronge

I have just received a communication from our Indian School Administration in Ottawa which says: "We are in receipt of a letter from the Indian Affairs Branch requesting that the December quarterly return from Lac la Ronge Residential School be expedited." The word "expedited" touches me on a raw spot; hence this letter.

I am happy to state that the said Return has lately been forwarded to your Carlton agency. What I wish to emphasize is the fact that the return was drafted by January 5, when I told Mr. Indian Agent Jones in person that I lacked sufficient forms to complete it in triplicate. My request for a year's supply of blue forms was noted. During the month I wrote twice to the Agency repeating my request. On February 2 the school was destroyed by fire, and the draft of my Quarterly Return with it. Later in the month, before I was transferred to Gordon's School, I reminded the Agent that I was still waiting for forms, and received a letter, dated Feb. 25, which concludes:

"Regarding the quarterly report forms, these have not been received to date, however, since we requested these to be mailed direct to you, they will no doubt eventually catch up to you."

In the race I am still leading. Records necessary to the compilation of a fresh Return, which were fortunately salvaged from the fire, came down to me from Lac la Ronge this month, and the much overdue report that I have sent forward was made out on forms borrowed from supplies here. I am still awaiting the promised supply.

In the circumstances it is hard for one to be expeditious, as I think you will agree.

Yours faithfully,

Acting Principal.

Formerly principal, All Saints School, Lac la Ronge, Sask.
Province of SASKATCHEWAN.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES
ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES
CANADA
June 29, 1948.

Dear Mr. Fisher:

In preparing our appropriation for the current fiscal year we provided for pupilage both at St. Alban's (formerly Onion Lake C.E.) and Lac la Ronge Residential Schools.

Our understanding is that there are now a number of children located in the former Army buildings at Prince Albert Camp and for bookkeeping purposes we would like to have two returns forwarded in future.

St. Alban's - the return for this particular school should show not more than 125 names.

Lac la Ronge - (in Prince Albert Camp) The return should be prepared headed "Lac la Ronge Residential School" and the names of the other children in residence should be placed on this return.

We will then be able to issue separate cheques for the amount of per capita due for both schools and as stated above, it will assist us a great deal in our bookkeeping. Both returns should be forwarded to the Department through the office of Superintendent Jones.

Yours sincerely,

Bernard F. Neary
Superintendent of Education.

Rev. G.W. Fisher,
St. Alban's Indian Res. School,
Prince Albert, Sask.

PP/MGD
c/o to Supt. Jones.

PUBLIC ARCHIVES
ARCHIVES PUBLIQUES
CANADA
January 18th, 1949

Colonel B. F. Neary,
Supt. of Indian Education,
Indian Affairs Branch,
Department of Mines & Resources,
Ottawa, Ontario.

Dear Colonel Neary:

Referring to your 875-3 (E.6) of 14th January, 1949, addressed to Miss Evans, M.S.C.C., with copy to us, it is noted that the adjustment for the June Quarter for Lac la Ronge School is only $227.70, whereas in the Schedule attached to your 150-2 (E.1) of 30th November, 1948, to us, this adjustment is shown as $675.38. Will you please advise me which of these two figures is the correct one.

It is noted from your letter of 14th January to Miss Evans that you have not yet determined the adjustment for March and June quarters for Alert Bay.

Yours truly,

Henry G. Cook
Superintendent
Memorandum:

MR. PHELAN.

This is the explanation to Canon Cook's question on Lac la Ronge.

The per capita rate for the June Quarter was paid at $215.00. This rate was increased to $286. which was a difference of $71.00

The average for the month of June was $38.05. The adjustment for June on this basis would be $675.38. This is the information that was given in the first instance.

The Auditor advised that there was 17% added to the original rate and as this was already paid, it had to be subtracted from the $675.38. The June statement shows that 17% of the earnings of $2,045.15 amounted to $347.66. Therefore, $675.38 less $347.66 amounts to $327.70 which is the amount of the adjustment.

M.F. Track.
Province of SASKATCHEWAN.

Dear Sirs:

Following up our letter to you of December 21st regarding quotation on NEW MOTOR BOAT to be delivered at Prince Albert Sask.

We quote you, as per your specifications with the following changes recommended: Keel to be 2½ x 3 or 4" and main keel to be of **oak** in place of Georgia Pine. Planking to be fastened with galvanized nails or galvanized or brass plated screws, where screws used. Built of Canadian Cedar, garboard of oak, shear streak of oak and small removable cover for engine. Tow post built right up behind engine and securely fastened to boat frames.

Boat complete with St. Lawrence 12 H.P. 2 cylinder engine, f.o.b. Prince Albert Sask. for $1250.00

Delivery 15 days after receipt of order.

The enclosed cut will offer some idea of style of boat.

We have built a number of boats for the Log Picking Association for towing and believe that this boat will meet your requirements fully.

Thanking you for the privilege of being permitted to tender and assuring you of our attention to this order should we be favoured with same, we are,

Yours faithfully,

Honey Harbour Navigation Co. Limited

Memorandum.

Honourable Charles Stewart:

The Lac la Ronge Indian Boarding School (C. of E.) in Northern Saskatchewan is situated on the shores of a lake. There is arable land 2½ miles across the bay from the school and it is accessible only by water. It is necessary to transport workers back and forth from time to time and also to tow a small scow containing horses or produce. The Missionary Society of the Church of England are willing to contribute $500 towards a suitable launch. Prices have been secured, and the lowest quotation ($1100 f. o. b. Prince Albert) was received from the Peterboro Canoe Company. Dr. Westgate, Acting General Secretary of the M. S. C. C., has approved of this boat.

It will be necessary to freight the boat, by sleigh, from Prince Albert - nearly 300 miles - and, as the time is very short, the Peterboro Canoe Company received the order by telegram, immediately upon receipt of the Minute number from the Purchasing Commission. $600 will be met from parliamentary appropriation, and I respectfully ask for your approval of the action that has been taken.

Deputy Superintendent General.

Dear Sir:

In reply to your letter of January 2nd, No. 132-2-5, in re an account from Revillon Freres, Lac la Ronge, for $203.04, to cover the transportation of Indian children to the Lac la Ronge Boarding School, I beg to state that in the covering letter received from the Principal dated December 4th, he stated that this account "is for transportation of children to the School", and makes no reference whatever to holidays or transportation of children from the School.

Dear Sir:

I beg to acknowledge the receipt of your letter dated January 5th No. 132-2-5 B., in which you inform me of the purchase of a motor launch for the Lac la Ronge Indian Boarding School, and to thank you very sincerely on behalf of our Society for your valuable assistance and co-operation in this matter.

I note that the Peterborough Canoe Company, from whom the launch has been purchased, have been informed that it will be subject to inspection upon its arrival in Prince Albert by someone appointed by me. In this connection I beg to state that I have requested the Rev. Arthur E. Minchin, A.M., Principal of the Mackay School at The Pas, to undertake this duty on my behalf, and his report, as soon as it has been received, will be forwarded to you.

I note that you have requested the Firm to have the boat delivered in Prince Albert not later than the 6th of February next if possible, and further that you will pay the entire sum of $1,100., the cost of the launch F.O.B. Prince Albert, direct to the Firm, and deduct the sum of $500., promised by our Society from the quarterly grant to the Lac la Ronge Boarding School.

Believe me, Sir,

Your obedient servant,

T.B.W./FEC

Field Secretary and Acting General Secretary M.S.C.C.

Indian Affairs. (RG 10, Volume 6316, file 656-5, part 3)
Dear Sir;-

your letter Jany 5th. recived, and while we certainly would like to have had this work come to us, we know that only one firm can build the boat.

In our specifications we figured very close and offered you more for your dollar than we believe can be bought elsewhere, this firm has never nd will never build a cheap boat, the best of everything goes into the construction, and we build a honest boat all the way thru.

The motor we offered is one of the best, and something that will run at all times, and that is what no two cycle motor ever done.

If it is only a question of price being the lowest without regard to value received it is not fair, to waste time on getting out, specifications, we want to get some of your work here, and we can only repeat that the work done in our shops is of the highest
that skilled workmen can turn out together with the best in materials, the motors we install are given utmost in every way known to engineers, so that when a complete boat leaves our works she is ready to startup and run all season, for her owners.

We want to put before you at this time, that we have been building boats up here for the last twelve years, and have turned out many of the best boats in the north, we know what is wanted and what is needed, our boats are not pleasure craft for running around the St. Lawrence River, and we are smart a little up here in Alberta when we see year after year boats coming up from Ontario with Two Cycle Engines installed, and taking three and four days to get them running, and the party's have to go on down the river leaving the engineer to follow as soon as he can get his outfit in shape.

We have a few cases where the Dept. have brought up useless craft from the east and spent part of the summer trying to get the thing to run.

We want to get all the Government business we can get and we want to get it without fear or favour from anyone, and we as boat builders know we are offering more for each dollar than can be had elsewhere, we trust that this letter will have your fair consideration, and that value received will have first consideration, and not lowest tender yours very truly.

Alberta Motor Boat Co Ltd.

[Signature]

Gentlemen:

I have to acknowledge receipt of your letter of the 9th instant, regarding the tender which you submitted for the supplying of a motor boat complete for delivery at Prince Albert, Sask.

In reply I beg to say that we called for competitive prices from a number of manufacturers. When these prices were received they were submitted to the Purchasing Commission of Canada, and we were instructed to place the order with the Peterboro Canoe Co. Ltd., Peterboro, Ont., their price being considerably lower than that quoted by you. I may add, further, that both the boat and engine selected are of a type satisfactory to the authorities of the Church of England, who will use the boat in connection with their work at the Lac la Ronge Indian Boarding School.

Jan. 15, 1923.

Rev. T.B.R. Westgate, D.D.,
Field Secretary, M.S.C.G.,
Winnipeg, Man.

Dear Doctor Westgate:

Referring to your letter of Dec. 15 Re Pump. I will try and give all the information that will be required. Distance from pump discharge to compression tank 225 feet. This is connected at present by 1½ inch pipe. This pipe gives sufficient capacity for discharge for us. The trouble is that the pump we have is not a strong enough built pump, and the engine is not powerful enough to put on the pressure that we require. We use about 800 gal. of water per day. Our well is 18 ft. deep, and the tanks are about 14 ft. above the well. The pump stands immediately over the well, and as I said above, connected with the compression tank by 225 ft. of pipe. It will save time and expense if this piping could be used again. We do not require a big outfit. The present pump which has a capacity of about 18 gal. per minute would be alright if it were stronger built, and if the engine, which is 1½ H.P., were powerful enough to do the work. The Canadian Fairbanks - Morse put out a very good pump and engine. I think the best on the market. I sincerely hope that an outfit may be forthcoming before the freighting season closes. It is very inconvenient working such a water supply system as this is, and it would be very inadequate in case of fire.

Yours faithfully,

(signed) Chas F. Hives.

Principal.

MEMORANDUM.

MR. PACET,

A new engine and pump are required in connection with the water supply at the Lac la Ronge Indian Boarding School. The type of machine required will be a 5 x 5 pump directly connected to a 3 H.P. Gas. engine.

The Principal of the school has specially requested that he be furnished with a pump and engine as manufactured by the Canadian Fairbanks-Morse Co. I may say that this type of machine is well known in the West, is strongly built, simple and has given perfect satisfaction wherever installed. The Reverend Principal is acquainted with this style of pump and engine, and it would therefore seem advisable that he be furnished with the above mentioned make.

The estimated cost of the pump and engine complete is approximately $415.00, and I beg to recommend, if the same is agreeable to the Purchasing Commission, that the school be furnished with a Fairbanks-Morse outfit.

The Purchase of this pump is recommended.

Accountant & Purchasing Agent.

Ottawa, 31st January, 1923.
MEMORANDUM

MR. SCOTT,

You will remember when Rev. Dr. Westgate called at your office about a month ago, he discussed the necessity of furnishing the Lac la Ronge School with a pump and gasoline engine.

Before I could determine the style of apparatus required, it was necessary to communicate with the Reverend Principal for the information desired. This has been received, and to make a satisfactory water supply system for the building, it will be necessary to install a 5 x 5 suction pump operated by a 3 H. P. gasoline engine. The Canadian Fairbanks-Morse manufacture a very satisfactory outfit of this nature with the engine directly connected to the pump, all mounted on one base, the cost of which is approximately $400.00.

The Reverend Principal is thoroughly acquainted with the Fairbanks-Morse outfit which is extensively used in the West. This has been submitted to the Purchasing Commission and they have approved of the above mentioned pump and engine being purchased from the Canadian Fairbanks-Morse Co.

I beg to recommend that the school be furnished with this pump and engine which will complete an efficient water supply system for the building.

[Signature]

Dear Doctor Westgate:

Referring to your letter of Dec.28,
re laundry, I am, under separate cover, enclosing plans of
the present building,in case you have not them in the office.
My idea was to extend the wing which accommodates the present
laundry, and make the proposed new laundry 20 X 28 ft. This
to have a basement similar to the basement under the main
part. To be connected with the main basement by a passage
was, and to be heated with a pipeless furnace. This would
have a room upstairs which would be used as a drying room,
which would be connected with the present drying which could
be used as an ironing room. The whole of the ground floor
would be the laundry proper, and should be sufficiently large
enough. Outside of proper laundry equipment we would require
boiler connected with the stove, for the purpose of supplying
sufficient hot water for the laundry. In a previous letter
I suggested using the present laundry for a bake room. I
really think this would be a great convenience for us. Our
kitchen is small for a school of our pupilage, and it would
relieve the congestion during busy time in the kitchen.

Yours faithfully,

(signed) Chas F. Hives
Principal
Dear Sir:

With further reference to my letter of November 28, concerning the provision of a suitable laundry and equipment for our Society's School at Lac la Ronge, along with my letter of November 27, setting forth the major requirements of other Schools, and the Deputy Superintendent General's reply dated December 4, No. 160-2, I now beg to enclose a copy of a letter just received from the Rev. C. F. Hives, Principal of our School at Lac la Ronge, in which he embodies certain suggestions in regard to the laundry in question.

I have carefully studied this and am of the opinion that the alterations and extensions he recommends would meet the requirements of the situation, and I trust that they may meet with your approval also, and the authorization be given for these to proceed.

Believe me, Sir,

Yours very truly,

PRINCE ALBERT,
SASKATCHEWAN

580890 November 5th, 1922.

Dear Mr. Orr,-

In reply to your letter of the 23rd ult. I would say that I have written to Rev. C. F. Hives, enquiring what the cost would be to build stone chimneys in the Lac la Ronge School building. Nothing of course can be done in the way of building until next summer, but the materials required should be sent out before spring. A quantity of cement will be required, whatever plan may be decided on to ensure making the chimneys as safe as possible. My idea is, that if they were built of stone in the basement up to the ground floor, and then reinforced concrete placed around the existing chimneys from the ground floor upwards, in accordance with the plan that you suggested, they would be quite safe.

The first plan was a good one if it had been properly carried out, but the concrete outside of the flue pipes is too thin, and sometimes, in the course of construction, the boxing was taken off before the concrete was sufficiently set and hardened.

As you no doubt understand, each chimney has a pipe or smoke stack, from the floor of the basement to the top, and until these pipes are burnt out, they should be safe, but of course means should be taken, as soon as possible, to avoid all risk.

I shall be glad to do anything that the Department wishes me to do in the matter, but, as the control of the Indian residential schools, is now absolutely out of the hands of the Diocesan authorities, it may be questioned whether it is advisable for me or any other Diocesan agent, to continue any activities in connection with them. Personally however I feel that, as the Department entrusted me with the erection of the building at Lac la Ronge, it is my duty to do what I can towards its satisfactory completion.

Yours very sincerely

R. Guernsey Orr Esq.
Architect for the Department,
Ottawa,

CANADA
Dear Mr Scott;-

On Nov. 27th, 1922, the Rev. Dr. Westgate, Secretary of our Indian Commission, wrote to you with regard to certain requirements needed to complete the Lac La Ronge School. Dr. Westgate has now written to me drawing attention to the fact that unless immediate action is taken on the letter in question it will not be possible to get the supplies through before Spring break-up. On Nov. 28th Dr. Westgate wrote a second letter to the Secretary of the Department with regard to the need of making larger provision for the laundry at Lac La Ronge, and also with regard to the supplying of mechanical equipment for the same. I shall be much obliged if you will let me know what action has been taken in connection with these important matters.

Believe me,

Yours very faithfully,

[Signature]
General Secretary.
Ottawa, April 4, 1923.

Dear Canon Gould:

I have your letter of the 29th ultimo, with reference to the requirements at the Lac la Ronge Indian Boarding School. The communications of your Dr. Westgate, dated November 27th and 28th, in this connection, were acknowledged by my No. 160-2 of December 4th; and I am pleased to inform you that arrangements have been made to ask Parliament to vote funds for a proper basement floor, for general repairs to the main building and to enlarge the laundry and equip it. Upon the advice of our architect, it was decided not to consider the erection of a verandah at this time.

I regret that it will not be possible to order the materials and to arrange for the needed alterations and improvements until after our Estimates have passed the House.

Yours very truly,

Duncan C. Scott

Deputy Superintendent General.

Dear Sir:

Pump and Engine for Lac la Ronge School.

With further reference to your letter of February 3, No. 132-2-5 C., which appears to have been written in reply to a communication from this office dated January 26, I beg to state that I received on April 6 the following wire from the Rev. C. F. Hives, Principal of the School:

"240 feet 2 inch pipe connection required for new pump before sleighing closes. Please wire immediately Manville Hardware, Prince Albert, if purchase sanctioned."

From the copy of Mr. Hive's letter dated January 15, which was forwarded to you in response to the request contained in your letter of December 12, No. 132-2-5, he states that the size of the pipe at present in use is 1½ inch. It would appear from his telegram, as quoted above, that the pump you forwarded requires 2 inch pipe, and as it was important that this should be forwarded before the trails break up I wired the order to the Manville Hardware people in Prince Albert, to have the piping forwarded at once. The bill for this piping has not yet come to hand, and although I am quite aware that the sanction of your Department is required before payment of bills such as this can be met, I trust that under the circumstances you may approve of the action I have taken, and undertake to meet this bill when presented.

Believe me, Sir,

Yours very truly,

[Signature]

Field Secretary, M.S.C.C.
